subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: Do you have to keep being right?  I m starting to get embarrassed.
messageBody:
Do you have to keep being right? I'm starting to get embarrassed.

John Cowan wrote:
>
> amd64_hacker scripsit:
>
> > What good is a spelling reform if you (or more importantly in this case
> > the computer) are not sure if a letter is an HUNG or an ING?
>
> These letters are the same in both sound and shape; not a good example.
> That case is not well-chosen, as HUNG and ING differ only in name, like
> Latin B, which is "bee" in English vs. "be" (2+29) in Spanish.
>
> Since Michael is away, I'm going to try to work out which letters have
> issues and which do not.
>
> > Add in ambiguity and you make both Shavian and Quikscript less useful.
>
> I agree.
>
> --
> Even the best of friends cannot John Cowan
> attend each others' funeral. cowan@... <mailto:cowan%40ccil.org>
> --Kehlog Albran, The Profit http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
> <http://www.ccil.org/%7Ecowan>
>
>
